results.title: Improved cardiac outcomes with combined atenolol and diazepam intervention in seizure.
results.text_hl: Improved cardiac outcomes with combined @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Diazepam @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003975 @@@diazepam@@@ intervention in @<m>DISEASE_Seizures</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizure@@@.

citations.NLM: Read MI, Millen RN, McCann DM, Harrison JC, Kerr DS, Sammut IA. Improved cardiac outcomes with combined atenolol and diazepam intervention in seizure. Epilepsia. 2018 Apr;59(4):854-865. PMID: 29512824

results.title: Diazepam-atenolol combination antagonizes aminophylline-induced convulsions and lethality in mice.

results.title: Atenolol offers better protection than clonidine against cardiac injury in kainic acid-induced status epilepticus.
results.text_hl: Both @CHEMICAL_Clonidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003000 @@@clonidine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ pretreatment attenuated @<m>DISEASE_Seizures</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizure@@@ activity and reduced KA-induced changes in heart rate, QTc interval and T wave amplitude observed during both bradycardic and tachycardic phases in saline-pretreated KA animals.

citations.NLM: Read MI, Harrison JC, Kerr DS, Sammut IA. Atenolol offers better protection than clonidine against cardiac injury in kainic acid-induced status epilepticus. Br J Pharmacol. 2015 Oct;172(19):4626-38. PMID: 25765931
citations.BibTeX: @article{25765931, title={Atenolol offers better protection than clonidine against cardiac injury in kainic acid-induced status epilepticus.}, author={Read MI and Harrison JC and Kerr DS and Sammut IA}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={172}, number={19}, pages={4626-38}}

results.title: Autonomic and cellular mechanisms mediating detrimental cardiac effects of status epilepticus.
results.text_hl: Both were prevented by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ treatment during @<m>DISEASE_Seizures</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizures@@@.

citations.NLM: Bealer SL, Little JG, Metcalf CS, Brewster AL, Anderson AE. Autonomic and cellular mechanisms mediating detrimental cardiac effects of status epilepticus. Epilepsy Res. 2010 Sep;91(1):66-73. PMID: 20650612

results.title: ECT for Post-stroke Depression: Beta Blockade to Modify Rise in Blood Pressure.
results.text_hl: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) was administered using intravenous beta-blockade with @CHEMICAL_Practolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011217 @@@practolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ prior to induction of anaesthesia to prevent the surge in blood pressure normally seen following the @<m>DISEASE_Seizures</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@convulsion@@@.

citations.NLM: Allman P, Hawton K. ECT for Post-stroke Depression: Beta Blockade to Modify Rise in Blood Pressure. Convuls Ther. 1987;3(3):218-221. PMID: 11940919
citations.BibTeX: @article{11940919, title={ECT for Post-stroke Depression: Beta Blockade to Modify Rise in Blood Pressure.}, author={Allman P and Hawton K}, journal={Convuls Ther}, volume={3}, number={3}, pages={218-221}}

results.title: Posterior Reversible Encephalopathy Syndrome After Renal Transplant: A Simple Solution for a Complicated Patient
results.text_hl: A 50-year-old man who had undergone a recent kidney transplant was admitted to our clinic due to multiple episodes of @<m>DISEASE_Seizures</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizure@@@. He had no prior history of @<m>DISEASE_Seizures</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizures@@@ or @DISEASE_Alcoholism @DISEASE_MESH:D000437 @@@alcoholism@@@.

citations.NLM: Haughey D, Narsipur SS. Posterior Reversible Encephalopathy Syndrome After Renal Transplant: A Simple Solution for a Complicated Patient Case Rep Nephrol Dial. 2015 Jan-Apr;5(1):20-5. PMID: 25849670

results.title: Conversion of discoid lupus to antiphospholipid syndrome and SLE.
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND: A 64-year-old man was admitted to hospital with increasing @<m>DISEASE_Seizures</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizure@@@ frequency, @DISEASE_Lethargy @DISEASE_MESH:D053609 @@@lethargy@@@ and confusion.

results.title: Severe lactic acidosis complicating metformin overdose successfully treated with high-volume venovenous hemofiltration and aggressive alkalinization.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@PATIENT@@@: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was a healthy 14-yr-old female found by a sibling following a @<m>DISEASE_Seizures</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizure@@@ of unknown duration, thought to be secondary to @DISEASE_Hypoglycemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@hypoglycemia@@@ as a consequence of a self-ingestion of @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Diclofenac @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004008 @@@diclofenac@@@.

citations.NLM: Harvey B, Hickman C, Hinson G, Ralph T, Mayer A. Severe lactic acidosis complicating metformin overdose successfully treated with high-volume venovenous hemofiltration and aggressive alkalinization. Pediatr Crit Care Med. 2005 Sep;6(5):598-601. PMID: 16148825
citations.BibTeX: @article{16148825, title={Severe lactic acidosis complicating metformin overdose successfully treated with high-volume venovenous hemofiltration and aggressive alkalinization.}, author={Harvey B and Hickman C and Hinson G and Ralph T and Mayer A}, journal={Pediatr Crit Care Med}, volume={6}, number={5}, pages={598-601}}

results.title: Dexmedetomidine and remifentanil in the perioperative management of an adolescent undergoing resection of pheochromocytoma -A case report-
results.text_hl: Preoperative preparation consisted of @CHEMICAL_Terazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C041226 @@@terazosin@@@ 1 mg, @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ 1.25 mg, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 25 mg, and @CHEMICAL_Levetiracetam @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077287 @@@levetiracetam@@@ 1 g daily for 2 weeks, which resulted in symptomatic improvement, normotension and prevention of @<m>DISEASE_Seizures</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizure@@@.

citations.NLM: Jung JW, Park JK, Jeon SY, Kim YH, Nam SH, Choi YG, Bang SR. Dexmedetomidine and remifentanil in the perioperative management of an adolescent undergoing resection of pheochromocytoma -A case report- Korean J Anesthesiol. 2012 Dec;63(6):555-8. PMID: 23277819
citations.BibTeX: @article{23277819, title={Dexmedetomidine and remifentanil in the perioperative management of an adolescent undergoing resection of pheochromocytoma -A case report-}, author={Jung JW and Park JK and Jeon SY and Kim YH and Nam SH and Choi YG and Bang SR}, journal={Korean J Anesthesiol}, volume={63}, number={6}, pages={555-8}}
